Subject: 	RE: CardConnect/Shift4 - Follow Up Items

Taylor,

A few follow-up items. Please note, that while our teams have
established a good working relationship over the last year, that can’t
continue to be the case if we rewarding for your ef orts with additional
business.
First, please remove all of the Shift4/Dollars on the Net test
transactions on the portal within the next 24 hours and make
restitution (within 48 hours) for $4,667.94. We had a whole
conference call on this topic alone in December, which should have
prevented this from ever occurring. The fact that transactions, codes,
etc. can appear on your reporting platform without consent or any
oversight is pretty alarming. It def nitely makes us question promoting
such a product to our mutual customers. Again, we expect all
traces of Shift4/Dollars on the Net transactions removed and
restitution made within 48 hours.
Second, we were not in a position to support Landry’s (all brands) on
your platform due to limitations and stability that we both identif ed
last week. You can’t call yourself a gateway and lack gateway
functionality (and blame the processor). Nor can you put mission
critical merchants on technology you acknowledge, is unstable.
Again, not sure how we are rewarding those kinds of actions with
additional business. Please remove at once.
Last, and probably most important, in many ways we are competitors
and you can not use us for R&D purposes. Nor, as was mentioned
in our conference call in early January, exploit customer data or
practices that undermine our overall strategy. I have attached
the agreement with Card Connect for your review. I would classify the
above issues as violations of the agreement, which have cost us
considerable time, resources and damages. Let this serve as notif cation
before we take additional action.

I am sure we can get past all of this. Have a good week.

Best,
Jared

Subject: RE: CardConnect/Shift4 - Follow Up Items

Jared,

I never like hearing a customer of ours is unhappy and am sorry to see us in
this position. I acknowledge your frustration and want to remedy this situation
as quickly as possible.

I believe there is a bit of miscommunication on a couple of things here, so
please allow me to address each of your items to the best of my knowledge:

1.      Portal Transaction - I think we can both agree the portal
transaction was clearly a mistake. As a processor, CardConnect
cannot take the liability of fraudulent transactions. I will certainly
address this on our end, but can assure you that this was *not*
intentional, and certainly was *not* set up with ill-intent. We
believe Shift4 should do the right thing, and reimburse the
amount to CardConnect immediately. I do appreciate that you are in
the payments industry as well, and trust we can collaborate on this
topic.

2.      Landry's - I have confirmed with our gateway team that
Landry's (all brands) are running successfully on CardConnect's
gateway. I am not aware of any stability concerns or limitations
that would prevent us from continuing to run this traffic. Please
let me know ASAP if you believe there is any risk here. I want to
address immediately.

3.      R&D - As you and Jeff discussed many, many, many times
CardConnect has partnered with Shift4 on P2PE because of your
superior solution, and extensive payment device integrations. It's
no secret that we also have a gateway, and compete at times as
well. CardConnect did not, nor are we intending to, ever use
Shift4's strategy to better ours. We feel we have the best
gateway/P2PE offering in the industry. I feel strongly we can
mutually benefit by working together.

I'd like to get on the phone today to clear the air. I'm happy to issue the $4,667.94
credit. What I don't want to do is set a precedent that this type of thing is
acceptable (on either side).

Best Regards,
Taylor

Taylor,

A few follow-up items. Please note, that while our teams have established a good
working relationship over the last year, that can’t continue to be the case if we
rewarding for your ef orts with additional business.
First, please remove all of the Shift4/Dollars on the Net test transactions on
the portal within the next 24 hours and make restitution (within 48 hours) for
$4,667.94. We had a whole conference call on this topic alone in December, which
should have prevented this from ever occurring. The fact that transactions,
codes, etc. can appear on your reporting platform without consent or any
oversight is pretty alarming. It def nitely makes us question promoting such a
product to our mutual customers. Again, we expect all traces of
Shift4/Dollars on the Net transactions removed and restitution made within 48
hours.
Second, we were not in a position to support Landry’s (all brands) on your
platform due to limitations and stability that we both identif ed last week. You
can’t call yourself a gateway and lack gateway functionality (and blame the
processor). Nor can you put mission critical merchants on technology you
acknowledge, is unstable. Again, not sure how we are rewarding those kinds of
actions with additional business. Please remove at once.
Last, and probably most important, in many ways we are competitors and you can
not use us for R&D purposes. Nor, as was mentioned in our conference call in
early January, exploit customer data or practices that undermine our overall
strategy. I have attached the agreement with Card Connect for your review. I
would classify the above issues as violations of the agreement, which have cost
us considerable time, resources and damages. Let this serve as notif cation before
we take additional action.

I am sure we can get past all of this. Have a good week.

Best,
Jared

Abe,

Just completed a call with Taylor. We have no interest in continuing this discussion, wasting resources or getting
into a “he said, she said situation” as a consequence of how CardConnect, as an organization, has chosen to manage
the relationship and mutual customers.

We notif ed CardConnect in January that we would be enforcing the terms of our agreement, dated June 8, 2015,
due to violations with respect to data use, customer solicitations and other practices that were clearly out of bounds.
This included that no existing customers could be touched and all new opportunities must be mutually agreed upon.
CardConnect has chosen not to follow this guidance.

All Shift4 R&D, customer data, intellectual property, pricing, etc. is of -limits and should not reside, in any form,
within the CardConnect environment. We don’t want any confusion whatsoever on this topic. Please take the
necessary steps to make sure this is understood throughout your organization.

Best,
Jared
